messages.Account.TOTP.Title: 雙重認證（2FA）
messages.Account.TOTP.Initializing: 正在檢查您帳戶的雙重認證狀態...
messages.Account.TOTP.Code.Description:
首先，您需要將一個安全碼輸入您的 TOTP 認證應用，例如 Authy 或者 Google Authenticator.

我們建議以掃描二維碼的方式輸入，但您也可以手動輸入。 千萬不要告訴他人您的安全碼。

如果您正在VR模式下，您可以通過按下 F8 切換到桌面模式。
messages.Account.TOTP.RecoveryCodes.Description: 把這些代碼保存在安全的地方。它們可以在您的手機丟失或損壞後，幫助您再次訪問您的帳戶。每條代碼只能使用一次。千萬不要告訴他人這些代碼。 如果您弄丟了它們，您將 永遠 失去對您帳戶的訪問權。
messages.Account.TOTP.Activate.Description:
要在您的帳戶上激活雙重認證， 請使用您認證應用所產生的六位數驗證碼來確保一切工作正常。

一旦激活，您將需要這些代碼來進行特定操作。
messages.Account.TOTP.Message.AlreadySetup: 您的帳戶已啟用雙重認證！
messages.Account.TOTP.Message.Error: 遭遇意外錯誤！請稍候重試。
messages.Account.TOTP.Message.SetupComplete:
恭喜！

您的帳戶已啟用雙重認證並享受其帶來的額外保護！

您還可以用 /enableLogin2FA 指令啟用此帳戶登錄時的雙重認證。
messages.Account.TOTP.Deactivate.Description:
目前雙重認證已 在您的帳戶上設置並激活。如果您需要取消它（例如：您丟失了手機或者恢復碼遭泄漏），您可以在此處進行操作。

取消雙重認證後，您可以再次設置啟用它，這將生成一個全新的安全碼與一套新的恢復碼。

如果您丟失了手機，且需要再次設置激活，我們 強烈 建議您馬上進行這項操作，因為每條恢復碼只能被使用一次，當其耗盡後，您將永遠無法訪問您的帳戶。
messages.Account.TOTP.Message.DeactivationComplet:
您帳戶的雙重認證已被成功取消。

您的帳戶正因此面臨更大的風險！

我們強烈建議您馬上重新設置啟用雙重認證，特別是當您因丟失手機而使用了恢復碼後。

messages.FullBody.Title: 全身/化身校正
messages.FullBody.HeightInstructions: 確保這是您的實際身高，否則校準將無法正常進行。人體模型應與頭顯和控制器相符。
messages.FullBody.HeightWarning: 這似乎不正確。確保它是您的實際身高。
messages.FullBody.MappingInstructions: 直立站立，確保跟踪器正在跟踪並被正確檢測到。
messages.FullBody.JustCalibrateAvatarDescription: 跳過全身校準，僅校準化身
messages.FullBody.CalibrateInstructions: 使自己與遊戲空間中的紅色身體覆蓋層對齊，然後按下兩個扳機鍵進行確認。確保您真實的腳和臀部與虛擬的盡可能接近。
messages.FullBody.BeforeCalibrationInstructions: 確保跟踪器正在跟踪且您的身高已設置
messages.FullBody.CalibratingPoseInstructions: 確保自己與參考對齊，然後按下兩個扳機鍵進行確認
messages.FullBody.AdjustAvatarInstructions: 調整化身的身體偏移，使其與參考最匹配
messages.FullBody.FineTuneCalibrationInstructions: 通過移動藍色參考來驗證和微調校準
messages.FullBody.CalibrateTrackersInstructions:
抓取並放置相對於跟蹤器的藍色身體部分，以調整其偏移量。它們應與跟踪器在您身體上的位置相匹配。 
 您可以在以後隨時通過重新打開此工具來調整校準。
messages.FullBody.HeightCompensationInstructions: 如果人體模型過高（彎曲）或過矮，請調整高度補償以達到最佳配合。
messages.FullBody.CalibrateAvatarPrompt: 需要調整化身配合度嗎？
messages.FullBody.CalibrateAvatarInstructions: 確保已映射所有身體部位，然後在其周圍拖動藍色球體，以使化身與身體參考最匹配。
messages.FullBody.AvatarHeightCompensationInstruc: 如果化身太高（最終彎成弓形）或太矮，在此處調整其高度補償使它更適合您的身高。
messages.FullBody.AvatarHeightCompensation: 化身高度補償: {n, number, percent}
messages.FullBody.AvatarSaveWarning: 完成校准後，不要忘記保存您的化身！
messages.FullBody.CalibrationFinishedInstructions: 如果您對校準滿意，則可以保存您的化身並退出。
messages.FullBody.CalibrationRedoInstructions:
如果校準有誤差，或是您想校準更多的化身，則可以進行更多的調整。您也可以在以後的任何時候重新打開此校準器以進行調整。 
 如果您僅更改了跟踪器，則無需再次校準化身。

messages.#Settings.OnlineStatusSettings.DefaultSt: This is the default status that you will start with after logging in, unless there's a previously remembered status.
messages.#Settings.OnlineStatusSettings.RememberM: Use this to control if your last online status should be preserved between logins or not. This includes any statuses other than Invisible, which is controlled via separate setting.
messages.#Settings.OnlineStatusSettings.RememberT: Your last online status will be remembered only if you log in again within this timeframe. If you take longer than this, you'll start with your default status instead.
messages.#Settings.OnlineStatusSettings.Invisible:
This controls how your last status is remembered specifically if you were last set to Invisible. Otherwise this functions the same.

The invisible status has a separate setting for privacy reasons, to ensure that if you were last set to invisible, you can ensure that you'll stay invisible at the next login even if your other statuses are not remembered.
Your last invisible status will be remembered only if you log in again within this timeframe. If you take longer than this, you'll start with your default status instead.
messages.#Settings.OnlineStatusSettings.AutoAwayT: Switch to Away when idle for

When you are idle for this amount of time, your online status will automatically be switched to Away. Once you come back, it will automatically be set back to previous state, unless you set it to Away manually.
messages.#Settings.GeneralControlsSettings.Primar: Which hand is considered your primary. Various systems use this for interactions, e.g. when equipping tools.
messages.#Settings.GeneralControlsSettings.Double: This controls the maximum amount of time that may pass between the first and second clicks of a double-click. If you are triggering double clicks too frequently, decrease this value. If you are having trouble triggering double clicks, raise this value.
messages.#Settings.MovementSettings.LeftSidewaysM: Use this to determine what the sideways joystick/touchpad motion on your left controller will do.
messages.#Settings.MovementSettings.RightSideways: Use this to determine what the sideways joystick/touchpad motion on your right controller will do.
messages.#Settings.MovementSettings.UseHeadDirect: When enabled, moving forward will move you in whatever direction you are currently looking for while in VR. When disabled, the direction your controller is pointing will be used instead.
messages.#Settings.MovementSettings.UseSmoothTurn: This will gradually rotate you when turning while in VR. This can be more immersive, but is more likely to induce nausea. Turn this setting off if you prefer snap turning.
messages.#Settings.MovementSettings.SmoothTurnExc: When enabled, a single joystick can either move you forward/backward or turn you, but never both at the same time. Enable this if you're often accidentally turning while just trying to move.
messages.#Settings.MovementSettings.SmoothTurnSpe: This setting controls how fast you will turn when smooth turning is enabled. The value is degrees per second, so a value of 360 will turn you full circle in one second at full joystick tilt.
messages.#Settings.MovementSettings.SnapTurnAngle: This is the angle (in degrees) you will rotate when you trigger a snap turn.
messages.#Settings.MovementSettings.NoClipSpeed.D: This controls how fast you'll move when you're using the Noclip locomotion specifically. This type of locomotion is often used for building and testing and as such is not controlled by the world you're in, while others typically are.
messages.#Settings.MovementSettings.MovementDeadz: This setting can be used to correct drift. Increasing this value will require you to tilt your joystick further to start moving.
messages.#Settings.MovementSettings.TurningDeadzo: This setting can be used to correct drift and prevent accidental turning when moving and turning on the same joystick. Increasing this value will require you to tilt your joystick further to start turning.
messages.#Settings.MovementSettings.MovementExpon: Use this to control the curve response when moving. You can use this to either start moving slow at first and then quickly ramp up or start moving faster immediately, depending whether the value is above or below 1.0
messages.#Settings.GrabbingSettings.DefaultHandGr:
This determines what your default grab mode for hands is when you spawn in new worlds.

<color=hero.yellow>Palm:</color> You will grab all objects that are near your palm.

<color=hero.yellow>Precision:</color> You will grab a single object between your index finger and thumb.

<color=hero.yellow>Auto:</color> Mode is automatically switched between palm and precision depending on the orientation of your hand.

<color=hero.yellow>Off:</color> You'll only be able to grab items with your lasers.
messages.#Settings.FullBodyTrackingSettings.BodyH: This is the angle deviation between feet and head, beyond which you'll be considered in a horizontal pose. This affects certain things like overriding your tracker poses with feet simulation.
messages.#Settings.GamepadSettings.ThumbstickLook: Use this to adjust the sensitivity of the speed at which the viewpoint is moved with the thumbstick.

Use this to control the curve response of the viewpoint movement with the thumbstick. With this setting, you can either start moving slowly at first and then ramp up quickly, or start moving faster immediately, depending on whether the value is above or below 1.0.
messages.#Settings.GamepadSettings.UseGamepadWhen: When this setting is enabled, any inputs from gamepads will be used even when the application window isn't currently focused. You can turn this off if you like to run other games at the same time that also use gamepad.
messages.#Settings.MouseSettings.MouseSensitivity: Overall mouse sensitivity for desktop interactions.
messages.#Settings.MouseSettings.MouseLookSpeed.D: Use this to adjust the sensitivity of how fast the camera looks around when in first or third person mode.
messages.#Settings.MouseSettings.MousePanSpeed.De: This controls how fast the view looks with mouse movement when in UI aligned viewing mode.
messages.#Settings.MouseSettings.MouseRotateSpeed: When holding items in desktop mode, this controls how fast they will be rotated around their axis with the mouse.
messages.#Settings.MouseSettings.MouseFreeformRot: When holding items in desktop mode, this controls how fast they will be rotated when using freeform rotation.
messages.#Settings.MouseSettings.ScrollWheelGrabM: When holding items in desktop mode, this controls how fast they will move back and forth with the scroll wheel on your mouse.
messages.#Settings.KeyboardLookSettings.LookEnabl:
When enabled, Keyboard Look allows you to move your head around using the arrow keys on your keyboard.
It is designed for scenarios when a mouse might not be available or suitable, such as when using a laptop or when accessible alternatives to a mouse are required.
messages.#Settings.KeyboardLookSettings.Horizonta: Use this to adjust how fast your head moves horizontally when using Keyboard Look.
messages.#Settings.KeyboardLookSettings.VerticalS: Use this to adjust how fast your head moves vertically when using Keyboard Look.
messages.#Settings.GeneralHapticsSettings.EnableC: Use this to enable or disable haptic vibration specifically on VR controllers.
messages.#Settings.GeneralHapticsSettings.EnableH: When enabled, you will receive haptic feedback from avatars and items in the world on your controllers and other haptic devices.
messages.#Settings.GeneralVRSettings.UseVRHotswit: When enabled, you will automatically be switched between VR and desktop mode when you take your VR headset on or off
messages.#Settings.TrackingSmoothingSettings.Hand: When enabled, this controls how much the hand position is smoothed out. Typically this is helpful for users with tremors and other accessibility issues that cause jitter.
When enabled, this controls how much the hand rotation is smoothed out. Typically this is helpful for users with tremors and other accessibility issues that cause jitter.
messages.#Settings.TrackingSmoothingSettings.Feet: When enabled, this controls how much the position of feet is smoothed out when using full body tracking. This can be useful to eliminate vibrations and jitter, but it also makes the trackers lag behind more and not respond to rapid motions as well.

When enabled, this controls how much the rotation of feet is smoothed out when using full body tracking. This can be useful to eliminate vibrations and jitter, but it also makes the trackers lag behind more and not respond to rapid motions as well.
messages.#Settings.TrackingSmoothingSettings.Hips: When enabled, this controls how much the position of hips is smoothed out when using full body tracking. This can be useful to eliminate vibrations and jitter, but it also makes the trackers lag behind more and not respond to rapid motions as well.

When enabled, this controls how much the rotation of hips is smoothed out when using full body tracking. This can be useful to eliminate vibrations and jitter, but it also makes the trackers lag behind more and not respond to rapid motions as well.
messages.#Settings.MediaPrivacySettings.MediaMeta:
When enabled, you will be excluded from metadata in captured media (typically virtual photos & audio clips). You will still appear in those media assets, but no information, such as your UserID and position in the scene will be stored alongside it.

If you become aware of any users are modifying their clients to ignore this opt out, please report them to the moderation team, as this would be considered harassment.
messages.#Settings.MediaPrivacySettings.HideInScr: Do not show me in screenshots

When enabled, you will not be rendered in screenshots captured in-game.

<color=hero.red>IMPORTANT:</color> Please note that this does not affect realtime cameras, screenshots taken by methods outside of the game or captures done through other methods in-world that might be part of the world's mechanics.
messages.#Settings.MediaPrivacySettings.StripImag: When enabled, strips metadata from images on import. Includes EXIF, Embedded comments, IPTC, XMP, and GEOTIFF metadata. This will also strip any location data (such as GPS) within that metadata. Does not, include files imported with the "Raw File" option.
messages.#Settings.DiscordIntegrationSettings.Ric:
Controls what information {appName} sends to Discord's Rich Presence systems.

<color=hero.yellow>None</color> - Do not send Rich Presence information to Discord.
<color=hero.yellow>Basic</color> - Send only limited details such as your presence in {appName}.
<color=hero.yellow>Full</color> - When in a public session, send all suitable session information to Discord. Includes the world name and how many users are in the session.

Discord itself also does its own detection to display what game you are playing. This can be disabled in Discord's settings.
messages.#Settings.SteamIntegrationSettings.RichP:
Controls what information {appName} sends to Steam's Rich Presence systems.

<color=hero.yellow>None</color> - Do not send Rich Presence information to Steam.
<color=hero.yellow>Basic</color> - Send only limited details such as your presence in {appName}.
<color=hero.yellow>Full</color> - When in a public session, send all suitable session information to Steam. Includes the world name and how many users are in the session.

Steam itself will display that you are playing {appName} regardless of this setting. Changing this setting only affects how much extra data is sent to Steam about your active session.
messages.#Settings.SteamIntegrationSettings.SaveS: When you take a picture with this setting enabled, a copy will be saved to Steam screenshots.
messages.#Settings.SteamIntegrationSettings.Force: Force Steam Voice when Remote Play is active

When enabled, this automatically forces the audio input to use Steam Voice when you play through Steam Remote Play. This helps so you don't need to switch automatically to use the forwarded microphone input.

Disabling this can be useful if you want to use your own audio device - e.g. external microphone.
messages.#Settings.LeapMotionSettings.LeapMotionE: When enabled, the Leap Motion device will be used to track your hands and fingers when present.
messages.#Settings.LeapMotionSettings.Offset.Desc: This is the offset in meters of the Leap Motion sensor on your VR headset. Tweak these values to make sure your hands are positioned correctly.
messages.#Settings.LeapMotionSettings.SnapDistanc: When your hands are within the range of controllers, they will automatically snap to them and use the hand tracking data from the controller itself, instead of Leap Motion. This controls the distance at which the hands will snap.
messages.#Settings.LeapMotionSettings.UseFingersW: When hands are snapped to controllers, this will still pose the fingers using data coming from the Leap Motion
messages.#Settings.ViveHandTrackingSettings.ViveH: When enabled, your hands and fingers will be tracked using the Vive hand tracking. This typically uses the cameras on the VR headset itself. You might need to enable the hand tracking in Steam VR settings.
messages.#Settings.ViveHandTrackingSettings.SnapD: When your hands are within the range of controllers, they will automatically snap to them and use the hand tracking data from the controller itself, instead of the headset cameras. This controls the distance at which the hands will snap.
messages.#Settings.ViveHandTrackingSettings.UseFi: When hands are snapped to controllers, this will still pose the fingers using data coming from the VR headset cameras
messages.#Settings.TrackerSettings.UseTrackers.De: Using this option you can globally disable all body trackers. This can be useful if your trackers are in a corner and charging, resulting in your avatar being crumpled up.
messages.#Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.UseTr: Should this tracker be used for tracking? You can use this to temporarily disable given tracker without having to reset its mapping.
messages.#Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.Freez: Enabling this will keep the tracker active, but freeze its current position and rotation. This setting is not persistent and will be reset on the next launch.
messages.#Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.Custo: You can give the tracker a custom name to make it easy to distinguish from others, rather than using its ID. This is mostly cosmetic, with no functional differences.
messages.#Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.Mappe:
Which body part is this tracker mapped to for full body tracking.

We recommend using the full body calibration to set this setting, instead of adjusting it manually here.

The position of the tracker relative to the body part that it's mapped to.

We recommend using the full body calibration to set this setting, instead of adjusting it manually here.

The rotation of the tracker relative to the body part that it's mapped to.

We recommend using the full body calibration to set this setting, instead of adjusting it manually here.
messages.#Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.UseIn: Should this tracker affect your avatar while in VR mode?
Should this tracker affect your avatar while in desktop mode?
messages.#Settings.TrackerSettings.Trackers.Track: Unique ID of this tracker. This information is considered private and is not the same ID as one that will be shown in world to avoid tracking through fingerprinting.
The current battery level of this tracker. Note that some trackers might not support tracking current battery level.
This indicates if the tracker is currently charging. Note that some trackers might not support reporting this information.
messages.#Settings.SteamLinkSettings.OSC_DataPort: Which port should be used for listening for OSC face tracking data. This should match the same port you set in SteamVR settings for the face tracking to work.
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.MappingTarg: Use this to configure which part of the avatar you want this device to be mapped to.
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.PointRadius: This lets you control the size of the haptic point on the avatar. Making it bigger will make it easier to trigger from bigger distances, but also results in less precision, as any haptic trigger within the point's volume will activate it.
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.TorsoHorizo: This is the horizontal position along torso, going from left to the right
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.TorsoVertic: This is the vertical position along torso, going from the bottom to the top.
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.TorsoSide.D: This indicates which side of torso should this device be mapped to (front or back)
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.HeadPitchAn: This controls position along the "vertical" axis of the head. The default position is the center of face (where your nose is). Increasing the angle will go upwards toward the top of your head. Decreasing the value goes downwards towards the chin.
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.HeadYawAngl: This controls the horizontal position around head, turning left or right. The center (where your nose is) is the default pose. Decreasing the value will go left, increasing will go right. This wraps all around the head in a circle at 180°, which is where the back of your head is.
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.ArmSide.Des: Which arm should this map to? Left or right?
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.ArmPosition: This controls the position along the arm. This starts at the shoulder and goes all the way to the wrist. Midway position is where the elbow is.
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.ArmAngleAro: This controls the angle around the circumference of the arm. The default 0° position is aligned with the top of your hand. Going negative will go left, positive to the right. Wrapping around 180° will put the point at the side of your arm where your palm is.
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.LegSide.Des: Which leg should this map to? Left or right?
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.LegPosition: This controls the position along the leg. This starts at the hips and goes all the way to the ankle. Midway position is where the knee is.
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.LegAngleAro: This controls the angle around the circumference of the leg. The default 0° position is aligned with the front of your leg - the direction your knee is pointing. Going negative will go left, positive to the right. Wrapping around 180° will put the point at the back side of your leg.
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.ControllerS: Which controller should this haptic point be mapped to? Left or right?
messages.#Settings.HapticPointMapping.Tag.Descrip:
Tag associated with this haptic point. This will map to the point on your avatar with a matching haptic tag specified on the TagHapticPointMapper component. If no point with this haptic tag is defined on the avatar, the haptic device will not work.

This is useful when you need full control over precise point on the avatar that the haptic device will be mapped to - e.g. when the generalized mapping doesn't suit your needs.
messages.#Settings.GiggleTechSettings.GigglePuckI:
If your GigglePuck isn't automatically detected on the network, fill its IP address in this field and then click the button below to add it manually.

Once added, go to "Manage GigglePucks" to configure it.
messages.#Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.Use: You can use this to enable or disable individual GigglePucks when they are mapped. Disabling the device will stop all the haptics.
messages.#Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.Alw:
When this is enabled, the GigglePuck will be always considered to be connected, even if it's not detected on the network.

This can be useful for certain networks that might have issues with automatic detection.
messages.#Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.Int: This lets you scale the intensity of the haptics sent to the GigglePuck. The actual strength of the haptics will never go beyond GigglePuck's maximum safe value - the values are clamped to safe maximum that will not overvolt the motor.
messages.#Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.Cus: You can use this to give this GigglePuck a custom name for easier reference. This is purely cosmetic and has no functional differences.
messages.#Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.Min: This is the minimum intensity that the haptic will be run at. When the intensity is too low, this can cause the haptic device to stall and stop responding.
messages.#Settings.GiggleTechSettings.Devices.Ini: When the haptics go from inactive to active, they will be run at at least this amount of intensity for a very short time period. This can help "kick-start" the haptics, when the activation value is too low for the motor to start spinning.
messages.#Settings.UserMetricsSettings.UserHeight:
This is your real world height, which is used to properly scale your avatar so it fits you well. It is also the height you will be placed at when you enable seated mode.

You can enter your height by using appropriate units, for example by typing <nobr><color=hero.yellow>175 cm</color></nobr> or <nobr><color=hero.yellow>1.75 m</color></nobr> for metric or <color=hero.yellow>5'11"</color> for imperial.
messages.#Settings.FavoritesSettings.AutoLoadClou: When enabled, your cloud home will be automatically loaded on startup. If you'd prefer it to not be loaded, you can disable this option. It will take effect next time you start.
messages.#Settings.AudioInputDeviceSettings.UseSy: Enable this to automatically use the input device you have set as default input in your system. If you'd like to override this and use a specific device instead, disable this option and configure the preferred devices below.
messages.#Settings.AudioInputDeviceSettings.Testi: You can use this to monitor and test the selected audio device to ensure it's working properly. Use the button to listen to the input, which will play the sound back at you.
messages.#Settings.AudioOutputDeviceSettings.UseS: Enable this to use the default system device for outputting audio. By disabling this, you can configure which audio device is used for outputting the audio below. This can be useful when you use different devices when toggling between VR and desktop.
messages.#Settings.AudioOutputDeviceSettings.Forc: Pressing this will force Resonite to refresh the audio device list. In most cases this should not be needed, but if Resonite is failing to pick up audio device that was added, using this might help.
messages.#Settings.AudioOutputDeviceSettings.Sepa:
When enabled, the streaming camera will render audio from its viewpoint and output it to a separate audio device.

This lets you keep your own audio from your perspective, while also capturing audio from the camera's perspective.

For this to work, the selected device must be different from your normal output device.
messages.#Settings.AudioVolumeSettings.MasterVolu: This controls the volume of everything uniformly. If everything is too loud or quiet, you can tweak this setting.
messages.#Settings.AudioVolumeSettings.SoundEffec: Adjust the volume of all sound effects. These are typically sounds that various items and gadgets make.
messages.#Settings.AudioVolumeSettings.Multimedia: Control the audio volume of various multimedia. Typically audio, music and video players are classified as multimedia as well as background sound tracks in the world.
messages.#Settings.AudioVolumeSettings.VoiceVolum: This controls the speech volume of all other users. In some cases pre-recorded voice clips will also be controlled by this setting. You can also adjust volume of individual users in the Session tab.
messages.#Settings.AudioVolumeSettings.UserInterf: With this setting, you can adjust the sound effects of UI specifically - hovering and pressing buttons, sliders, some tools interactions, capturing photos and so on.
messages.#Settings.AudioAccessibilitySettings.Whi: When you have Whisper mode activated, this indicates how loud sounds outside of the sphere will be. If they are too loud or too quiet, you can use this to tweak the volume attenuation.
messages.#Settings.AudioAccessibilitySettings.Voi: This indicates how loud other sounds will be when you are recording a voice message in Contacts. This can help prevent "voice jamming", making it easier to focus on what you are saying.
messages.Settings.AudioAccessibilitySettings.Forc: 強制關閉語音對話效果

開啟本選項會強制關閉套用在其他人的語音對話效果（例如迴音等）。若你會因為語音對話效果造成聽解困難，本功能會有幫助。

重要：世界可以因遊戲流程因素覆蓋這個設定，在此情況下本功能不會有任何作用。
messages.#Settings.AudioInputFilteringSettings.Us: This feature will try to ensure that your voice input is brought to a uniform level. This helps make your volume the same as other users, regardless of your microphone settings. We strongly recommend to keep this setting on to ensure you can be heard well by other users.
messages.#Settings.AudioInputFilteringSettings.No: Noise gate prevents background noises from being transmitted to other users. This setting indicates the maximum volume at which sounds will be filtered out. If too much noise is making it in, increase this setting, if your voice is not getting through, lower it.

This indicates how fast the noise gate responds to an incoming sound that is louder than the threshold volume. Larger values will result in a slower volume fade in, while smaller ones will make the volume ramp up quicker.
This controls how long it takes for the noise gate to begin to close after the microphone input volume falls below the threshold volume.
This setting controls how fast the noise gate closes after the incoming audio has quieted again.

Using this setting you can control the threshold when the incoming audio will become amplified. If your normal speech is too quiet and it's not getting amplified, lower this setting. If random quiet noises are being amplified, increase it.
messages.#Settings.AudioInputFilteringSettings.Us: This feature processes the incoming audio to filter out various undesirable noises. This can clean up audio from noisy microphones considerably, producing a cleaner voice. We strongly recommend keeping this setting on. However, it can also filter out certain noises that do not get identified as speech.
messages.#Settings.AudioPerformanceSettings.MaxVo:
This controls how many sounds can be playing concurrently. Increasing this will allow you to hear more sounds at once at the cost of CPU usage.

If you set this too high, you might hear audio crackling.
messages.#Settings.AudioPerformanceSettings.Simul:
This controls how much audio data is computed in one go when rendering audio. Increasing the value can improve performance in some ways, but will come at the cost of less frequent audio events and increased latency.

Generally we do not recommend changing this value and keeping the default 1024.
messages.#Settings.AudioPerformanceSettings.Outpu:
This controls the size of the buffer for audio playback. Higher values will have more audio latency, but are more resilient to crackling and pops.

By lowering this value you can decrease the audio latency, but the system will be more susceptible to crackling and drops.
<color=hero.yellow>Start Unmuted:</color> When you log in, you will always start unmuted.

<color=hero.yellow>Started Muted:</color> When you log in, your voice will always start muted. You will either have to unmute or press the "push to talk" key (V by default) to speak.

<color=hero.yellow>Remember Last: </color> When you login, the status from the last time you logged out will be preserved.
messages.#Settings.EarmuffSettings.EarmuffEnabled:
When earmuff mode is activated, voices of users will be significantly attenuated based on their distance and the direction you are facing.

In effect, this creates a "listening cone", which can help when there are too many overlapping voices in a world.
messages.#Settings.EarmuffSettings.Directionality:
This controls how directional the voice attenuation is. At 0 %, voices behind you will be at same volume as voices same distance in front of you. At 100 % values, you will not hear voices behind you unless they're really close.

If you want to hear voices behind you better, lower this value.
messages.#Settings.EarmuffSettings.Distance.Descr: This controls the distance in front of you (and behind you if directionality is 0 %) beyond which will voices become quieter.
messages.#Settings.EarmuffSettings.Angle.Descript: This controls the angle in front of your face within which the voices are at their normal level. Any voices beyond this angle will start attenuating once they reach the transition distance.
messages.#Settings.EarmuffSettings.TransitionStar: This controls the distance from the "listening cone" at which voices will become quieter. It's recommended to keep this above zero, because that will better include voices on the sides and voices near your head (e.g. users who are technically behind you, but very close).
messages.#Settings.EarmuffSettings.TransitionLeng: Use this to control the distance over which the voices will fade from their normal volume to fully attenuated. Larger values will transition the volume more smoothly, while lower values will result in more abrupt transition.
messages.#Settings.EarmuffSettings.VolumeAttenuat: This controls how loud voices beyond the "listening cone" will be. Setting this to 0 % will completely mute all users beyond the listening cone.
messages.#Settings.RealtimeNetworkingSettings.Dis: This disables networking features specific to local networks, such as broadcasting your session on the local network or listening to other sessions broadcasted on this network.
messages.#Settings.RealtimeNetworkingSettings.Pre: When enabled, you will connect via Steam Networking Sockets protocol if possible. This can help in some cases when LNL protocol results in significant queuing. However as this protocol is missing some features, you can run into more networking instability, so we recommend only enabling this once you ran into issues.

When enabled, connections over TCP are preferred over all other protocols. This mostly affects connections on LAN, as TCP is not used for connections over the internet by default.

TCP can have better performance on LAN networks and work on certain networks where UDP based protocols won't work.

However they can also suffer from "head of line" blocking, causing voices and poses to be significantly delayed.
messages.#Settings.RealtimeNetworkingSettings.LNL:
This controls the LNL protocol window size for real time networking. Changing this setting will have an immediate effect in all active sessions.

If you experience any packet queuing, you can increase this value to improve the connection throughput. However, higher values can also destabilize the connection further, so be careful.

<color=hero.yellow>Default Value:</color> 64

<color=hero.red>IMPORTANT:</color> This setting is for diagnostics and a temporary workaround; this value will automatically adjust itself in the future.
messages.#Settings.AssetGatherSettings.MaxConcurr: Maximum number of concurrent asset transfers

When hosting sessions, this indicates how many locally imported assets can be transferred at the time. Increasing this can transfer assets to users faster, but can also degrade the quality of the network connection. We recommend testing what values can your network handle.
Use this to control how many assets can be downloaded at the same time. Using bigger value can speed up loading of worlds, but can also overload your network, so use caution when tweaking this value.
messages.#Settings.HostAccessSettings.Entries.All: This indicates if HTTP(s) requests are allowed for this host. These are typically REST API requests to communicate with a third party services.
This indicates if realtime Websocket connections are allowed for this host. These are often used for more realtime bi-directional communications and data streams.
This indicates if {appName} can receive and process OSC data
This controls if {appName} is allowed to send data via OSC protocol to given host
messages.#Settings.HostAccessSettings.Entries.Rem: Remove entry (you will be asked again next time)
messages.#Settings.WindowsSettings.KeepOriginalSc: Enable this to avoid converting captured screenshots to JPG or PNG when saving them to the Documents folder in Windows. This can make them more difficult to use, as some apps might not be able to open the format.
messages.#Settings.DebugSettings.DebugInputBindin: When enabled, you will see debugging information for the input binding system. This is mostly useful for developers.
messages.#Settings.DebugSettings.ConvertParticleS:
Enabling this option will run a conversion from the legacy particle system to the new custom one (PhotonDust) for any newly loaded items and worlds.

This is intended for testing purposes only! If you are not part of testing, we do not recommend turning this option on, YOUR CONTENT MIGHT BE CORRUPTED AS A RESULT.

Please see our GitHub/Discord if you'd like to help with testing.
messages.#Settings.LegacyFeatureSettings.UseLegac: Double press grip to equip items
When enabled, you can equip tools and gadgets by pressing grip twice in rapid succession. This setting will likely get removed at some point.
When enabled, the app button on your non-primary hand will open a legacy world switch to switch between active worlds. This feature will be replaced in the future by a more flexible solution.
When enabled, when you hold grip and press the App button (that normally opens/closes dash), it will open the legacy inventory or session menu.
messages.#Settings.LegacyFeatureSettings.Suppress:
This is to make certain features like posers that hijack feet proxies work, without having to modify them.

If you turn this on without using posers or similar features, the animations will NOT look correct. Turn this off after you're done using posers.

IMPORTANT: This will likely be removed at some point, we recommend upgrading posers to be compatible with the new system and automatically suppress the simulation when active.
messages.#Settings.LegacyFeatureSettings.Preserve:
When turned on, any legacy audio content that has spatialization enabled will automatically ignore reverb zones to preserve limitation of the legacy audio system.

Turn this setting on and load the legacy content again. Once you save the converted legacy content, the choice will be "baked in" and you'll have to change it manually afterwards.
messages.#Settings.TwitchInterfaceSettings.Channe: This sets the default Twitch channel name for the Twitch Chat panel in the Camera Controls panel. This is mostly used by Twitch streamers who want to see their Twitch chat.
messages.#Settings.MessagingPrivacySettings.DoNot: Do not send realtime read status
When enabled, other users won't be able to see when you have read their messages immediately. You will also not see when they have read yours.
messages.#Settings.LocaleSettings.CultureLocaleCo: When set, this will override the default culture locale used for formatting numbers and other quantities. Normally the culture of your selected locale will be used, but this lets you mix and match them. E.g. using your native language with US culture.
messages.#Settings.LocaleSettings.UseImperialUnit: When enabled, editors for quantities (length/height, mass, volume...) will try to use imperial units instead of metric. Useful if you're from the US, UK, Liberia or Myanmar.
messages.#Settings.DashSettings.DashCurvature.Des: This controls how curved the dash is when you are in VR. Setting it to 0 will make it completely flat.
messages.#Settings.DashSettings.OpenCloseSpeed.De: Use this to adjust how quickly the dash opens and closes. If you don't like the animation, you can set this to very high value so dash opens and closes near instantly.
messages.#Settings.DashSettings.AllowReplacingSet:
When enabled, you'll be able to pick the Settings facet on the dash when in UI edit mode and replace it with another.

This setting needs to be off if you want to pick the individual settings as facets. It's recommended to turn this on temporarily when you want to replace the settings UI with custom and then disable it again.
messages.#Settings.NotificationSettings.UserOnlin: This controls if you'll get notifications when your contacts come online.
messages.#Settings.NotificationSettings.UserSocia:
When one of your contacts becomes sociable, you will receive a distinct notification with sound, so you can invite or poke them!

If you don't like these notifications, you can turn this off, which will treat Sociable status as no different from user coming Online for notifications.
messages.#Settings.NotificationSettings.UserOnlin: Contact Online on an incompatible build
This controls if you'll get notifications when your contacts come online when they are using a build that's not compatible with your own (e.g. a new version or pre-release builds).
messages.#Settings.NotificationSettings.Message.D: This controls notifications you will get when you receive messages.
messages.#Settings.NotificationSettings.Invite.De: This controls if you get notifications when you are invited to a session.
messages.#Settings.NotificationSettings.InviteReq: This controls if you get notifications when you receive an invite request that you can respond to.
messages.#Settings.NotificationSettings.ContactRe: This controls what notifications you get when you receive a contact request from someone
messages.#Settings.NotificationSettings.ContactSe: This controls what notifications you get when a new session is started by one of your contacts.
messages.#Settings.NotificationSettings.PublicSes: This controls what notifications you get when a new public session is started by a person that's not your contact.
messages.#Settings.NotificationSettings.UserJoinA: When enabled, you will receive notifications when users join and leave the world you're currently in.
messages.#Settings.NotificationSettings.Permissio: When enabled, you will be notified when your permission role is changed in a world. E.g. when you are changed from Guest to Builder.
messages.#Settings.NamePlateSettings.NameplateVis: Use this to control whose nameplates will be visible to you.
messages.#Settings.NamePlateSettings.UseCustomNam: If some nameplates are difficult to read, completely hidden or you need to see user's actual username and badges (e.g. for moderation purposes), you disable custom nameplates and see the default ones.
messages.#Settings.CustomizationSettings.UserInte:
When enabled, you'll be able to edit placements of Facets (modular pieces of UI) in the dash and on the facet anchors on your hands and viewport (if those are enabled).

Remember to turn this setting off once you are done! You can also turn it off using dedicated button under the dash.
messages.#Settings.FacetAnchorsSettings.UseFacetA: When enabled, you will be able to use the app button on your right controller to toggle facet anchors on your arms and forearms. These provide space to place any facets for quick access in addition to the main dash.
messages.#Settings.FacetAnchorsSettings.Animation: This determines how quickly the facet anchors appear and hide when toggled.
messages.#Settings.FacetAnchorsSettings.FacetAnch: This controls which controller (left or right) will toggle the facet anchors. The dash will be toggled with the other controller.
messages.#Settings.FacetAnchorsSettings.ShowConta: Turning this off will disable the background visual on the facet anchors, making the facets themselves the only visible part.
messages.#Settings.LaserSettings.SmoothSpeed.Desc: Use this to control how fast the laser responds to your movements. Lower values will make the laser more sluggish, but better at filtering tremors. Higher values will be more responsive, but also transfer more controller shake.
messages.#Settings.LaserSettings.ModulateStartAng: This indicates the angle at which the laser smoothing speed will start modulating to catch up to your movements. Increasing this value will require larger movements for the laser to start catching up.
messages.#Settings.LaserSettings.ModulateEndAngle: Related to the modulate start angle, this indicates when the modulation will reach maximum speed. By changing the start and end angles, you can control how responsive the laser is the more you move your hand.
messages.#Settings.LaserSettings.ModulateExponent: This controls the response curve of the laser modulation between the start and end angles. You can use this to either make the laser respond more sluggishly at first or to start responding quickly and then tapering off.
messages.#Settings.LaserSettings.ModulateSpeedMul: The laser smoothing speed will be multiplied by this value once you have reached the modulate end angle. Increasing this value will make the laser catch up quicker once you move your hand far enough. Lowering the value will make it take longer to catch up.
messages.#Settings.LaserSettings.StickThreshold.D: This controls how much the laser will stick to interactive items. Larger values will make it stick more. Setting this to zero will stop the stickiness completely.
messages.#Settings.LaserSettings.ShowInDesktop.De: When on, the laser visual will be rendered to you fully when in first person view in desktop mode.
messages.#Settings.EditSettings.ConfirmComponentD: When enabled, you'll be asked for confirmation before destroying a component in the inspector. This helps prevent destroying them accidentally with misclick.
messages.#Settings.EditSettings.ConfirmSlotDestro: When enabled, you'll be asked for confirmation when destroying Slots with the Developer Tool. This can prevent accidentally destroying objects when misclick.
This sets a base cursor size. We recommend setting this first, before adjusting the others as their size is relative to this.
This is applied as a multiplier to your cursor while grabbing objects and items.
messages.#Settings.CursorSettings.InteractionMult: This is applied as a multiplier to your cursor while interacting with UI elements such as buttons.
This is applied as a multiplier to your cursor while interacting and manipulating text.
messages.#Settings.CursorSettings.SliderMultiplie: This is applied as a multiplier to your cursor while interacting with sliders and scrollbars.
messages.#Settings.DesktopViewSettings.FollowCurs: When enabled, the Desktop view will automatically switch to whichever screen is your cursor on. This is useful when you're using physical keyboard and mouse while in VR.
messages.#Settings.DesktopViewSettings.Brightness: The brightness of the desktop view.
messages.#Settings.DesktopViewSettings.Opacity.De: Lower the value to make the desktop view semi-transparent, making it easier to see what's behind it in the world.
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.FingerGes: When enabled, you can quickly take pictures in world by posing your fingers to make a picture frame and then curling one of your index fingers.
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.NormalCap: This sets what resolution normal photos captured by the finger gesture or the desktop key shortcut will be. Higher resolutions will take more time and storage to process, but give better detail.
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.TimerCapt: Similar to normal resolution, you can set a separate resolution for photos captured with the timer feature. This can be useful if you use timer to capture group photos, which can benefit from higher resolution.
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.TimerSeco: How many seconds does it take before a photo is captured with the timer feature.
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.HandsNear: Field of view for photos captured by the finger gesture while your hands are closest to your head.
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.HandsFarF: Field of view for photos captured by the finger gesture while your hands are furthest from your head.
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.CaptureSt: When enabled, all quick photo captures will be stereoscopic. This is mostly useful when viewed in VR.
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.StereoSep:
Use this to control the separation between the stereo cameras when the stereo mode is on. This controls how distant the cameras are from each other, which affects the strength of the stereo effect for more distant objects.

When capturing close up objects, lower values will work better, when capturing large scenes, larger values will work better.
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.PhotoAuto:
When set, any photos you capture (or save with context menu) will be automatically saved to your in-game inventory. For example <color=hero.yellow>Photos/%year%/%month_name%</color>

Following variables are available:

<size=75%>%second%, %minute%, %hour%, %day%, %month%, %year%, %day_name%, %day_name_en%, %month_name%, %month_name_en%, %session_second%, %session_minute%, %session_hour%, %session_day%, %session_month%, %session_year%, %session_day_name%, %session_day_name_en%, %session_month_name%, %session_month_name_en%, %location_name%, %app_version%</size>
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.OpenAutos: Open autosave path for current world

If you have photo autosave configured, clicking this will open Inventory at the location where photos are saved for the world you're currently in at the current time.

Make sure that you've taken some photos in this world already, otherwise this action will fail, because the folder will not exist yet!
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.CapturePr:
When enabled, the quick photo capture will render your private UI such as the dash. This can be useful in case you want to show information there.

We recommend turning this setting off once you're done, as leaving it on can lead to accidentally capturing and leaking your private information.
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.EncodeFor:
The image file format which captured photos will be encoded into. If you need the photos to be in particular format, you can use this setting to select which one they'll be encoded in.

Please note that certain formats might lack some features (like alpha support), might encode significantly slower, have lower image quality or result in bigger files.
messages.#Settings.PhotoCaptureSettings.AlwaysHid: Turn this on if you want nameplates to never show in your photos. This setting is independent of the current nameplate visibility and will always ensure that they are hidden in captured photos.
messages.#Settings.DesktopRenderSettings.FieldOfV: Use this to control the field of view (FOV) when in desktop mode. Larger values will give you wider view at the cost of greater distortion on the sides.
messages.#Settings.DesktopRenderSettings.SprintFi: When this option is enabled, your FOV will be zoomed when you are sprinting in Desktop. Disable this setting to remove this effect. Please note that this does NOT disable effects found in User Generated Content.
messages.#Settings.DesktopRenderSettings.VSync.De:
When this option is enabled, the framerate will be synced with the refresh rate of your screen. Disabling this can render frames faster, but it will also cause visible tearing.

This can be useful when doing performance testing as it will uncap the update and rendering speed.

<color=hero.red>IMPORTANT:</color> This setting cannot be toggled while in VR since framerate is controlled by VR.
messages.#Settings.DesktopRenderSettings.LimitFra: When enabled, the framerate will be limited to a set value when the application window is unfocused. This is useful if you use other programs and games at the same time, as it will free up more resources for them.
messages.#Settings.DesktopRenderSettings.MaximumB: This determines the allowed maximum framerate while in background. Lower values will conserve more system resources.
messages.#Settings.InteractiveCameraFramingSettin: This controls how the interactive camera is positioned in the world.
The field of view of the interactive camera. Higher values will capture more of the scene at the cost of distortion at the edges.
In third person or group mode, this controls position around circle of the target subject/group.
In third person or group mode, this controls how far away the camera is from the target subject/group.
In third person or group mode, this lets you move the camera higher or lower relative to the target subject/group.
In first person mode, use this to pitch the camera up and down.
In first person mode, this controls the sideways rotation of the camera - tilting of left and right
Use this to move the camera offset in first person view relative to your eyes. This can be used if the avatar face geometry is clipping into the camera's view.
These are normalized coordinates in the camera's viewport. The camera will try to frame the target (e.g. user's head in third person mode) to this position in the viewport.

Instead of camera pointing directly at the user's head, it will try to aim at a point in front of user's head. This can be useful when you want to frame what the user is looking at (e.g. in-world items and interfaces).
messages.#Settings.InteractiveCameraPositioningSe: If the view of the camera would be obscured by collidable object, it will automatically move closer to avoid the occlusion.

Make sure that the camera stay in the root world space, rather than parenting itself in the same space as the user. This can give better framing and positioning when using user anchors (e.g. in vehicles).
This adds a random movement offset to the position of the camera that changes over time. This can make shots look less static, especially if you don't move much.
messages.#Settings.InteractiveCameraRenderSetting: The camera will not render any user badges, regardless of your badge setting.
The camera will not render any user interaction lasers.
User eyes always look at camera
When avatar uses simulated eye movement (meaning the user doesn't have eye tracking), this will make avatar prioritize eye contact with the camera.
messages.#Settings.InteractiveCameraGroupSettings: Users that are within this distance will be added to the group that the camera is automatically framing in the group mode.
How far does the user need to move away from the group radius before they are excluded from the group.
messages.#Settings.InteractiveCameraSmoothingSett: This indicates how fast does the camera move to its target position in the world. Larger values will make the camera move faster, but also result in more jerky movements.
This indicates how quickly does the camera respond to change in angle around the target subject.
This controls how fast the camera adjusts its framing of the target subject. Larger values will make it track the target faster, but also result in more jerky movements.
messages.#Settings.InteractiveCameraAnchorSetting: When enabled, camera will smoothly interpolate between camera anchors in the world.
When interpolation between anchors is enabled, this controls how fast the camera moves from one anchor to another.

Enable this to use linear interpolation when moving between anchors instead of a smooth one. Linear interpolation starts and stops abruptly, but has a constant movement speed, regardless of the distance between anchors. This means that if anchors are further apart, it'll take longer for the camera to reach it.
messages.#Settings.InteractiveCameraPhotoSettings: When you take photos using the interactive camera dialog, should they be spawned into the world? When disabled, they will only be saved to your documents or inventory (if autosave is configured)
messages.#Settings.InteractiveCameraPostProcessin: Should the camera render motion blur effect?
Should the camera render screen space reflections effects? This can provide better reflections for shiny surfaces, but can lead to artifacts and increased performance requirements.
messages.#Settings.InteractiveCameraAudioSettings:
When the audio output for the interactive camera is separated to its own audio device, this controls whether the camera will hear your own voice or not.

This is useful to make your own voice rendered fully spatilized as it would be heard by other users in the world.

Make sure to disable microphone capture in your recording software when this option is on.
messages.#Settings.DescriptionField.NoTextDescrip: <i><alpha=#77>Hover over a setting to see its description.</closeall>
messages.#Settings.RelaySettings.AlwaysUseRelay.D: Relays are typically used as a fallback when a direct connection to the host cannot be established. By enabling this option, you will force the connection to always happen through a relay. This can be useful in cases of connection issues to particular hosts. It is NOT recommended to have this option permanently on.
messages.#Settings.RelaySettings.UseClosestAvaila: When this option is enabled the closest available relay will be automatically selected. If you want to connect through a specific relay (e.g. in case of long distance connections to avoid packet queuing) you can disable this option and configure the preferred relays below.
messages.#Settings.VideoStreamingServicesSettings: If YouTube and other service videos are not loading for you, select the browser you typically use to load cookies from when fetching those videos. This increases the chances of video loading successfully.
messages.#Settings.PostProcessingSettings.MotionB:
This controls the strength of the motion blur effect, which smears image with motion. Higher values will result in more blurring with same amount of motion.

If you set the effect to <nobr><color=hero.yellow>0 %</color></nobr> the filter will be disabled completely, which can improve performance.
messages.#Settings.PostProcessingSettings.BloomIn:
Bloom effect causes a glow to appear around bright objects in the scene, typically with ones in the HDR range. This lets you control the strength of this effect for the same amount of light. 

Please note that some content can look incorrect when this effect is set to low or disabled.

If you set the effect to <nobr><color=hero.yellow>0 %</color></nobr> the filter will be disabled completely, which can improve performance.
messages.#Settings.PostProcessingSettings.Ambient:
Ambient Occlusion darkens creases and corners in the scene, which would typically receive less light. This can give the scene more depth and realism. Using this control you can control the intensity of the effect.

Please note that by setting this too low or disabling it, some content might look incorrect or completely flat when it otherwise would not.

If you set the effect to <nobr><color=hero.yellow>0 %</color></nobr> the filter will be disabled completely, which can improve performance.
messages.#Settings.PostProcessingSettings.ScreenS:
When enabled, any parts of the scene currently visible to the camera will reflect off shiny surfaces in realtime. This can add more realism to the scene and improve look of shiny surfaces at cost of extra performance.

Please note that this filter is considered experimental right now and does not work well in a lot of scenarios, resulting in ghostly reflections and artifacts.
messages.#Settings.PostProcessingSettings.Antiali:
Antialising smooths out sharp jagged edges on objects in the scene. You can select from several different filters, with each filter having different downsides. FXAA is commonly used and works reasonably well enough, but can also blur other parts of the scene, such as text.

<color=red>Warning:</color> Some AA options might not be suitable or work at all in VR.
messages.#Settings.TextureQualitySettings.Texture:
This determines the relative size of all textures that will be loaded. You can use this to lower the overall resolution of textures, which improves VRAM usage and loading speed at the cost of visual clarity.

For example if the texture is 4K and you set this to half resolution, 2K version of the texture will be loaded instead.

Use this to limit the maximum resolution of loaded textures. Any textures above this resolution will be limited to the set resolution. Any textures that are smaller than this will not be affected.

This setting is applied after the relative texture size.
messages.#Settings.TextureQualitySettings.Minimum:
This controls the minimum resolution of the texture that will be limited by the settings above. If the texture is below this size, it will be loaded as is.

E.g. if you set this to 512, then if texture is 256, it will be still loaded as 256 even if the texture size ratio is set to half.
messages.#Settings.TextureQualitySettings.Default:
This controls the filtering used for textures, which controls their quality and performance.

<color=hero.yellow>Point:</color> Lowest quality with no interpolation. Textures will be blocky.

<color=hero.yellow>Bilinear:</color> Texture pixels are interpolated, but mip map transitions will be harsh, leading to a visible transition line.

<color=hero.yellow>Trilinear:</color> Smoothly transitions between different mip levels, removing the harsh transition line at distance.

<color=hero.yellow>Anisotropic:</color> Highest quality, textures will be sharp even at steep angles.
messages.#Settings.TextureQualitySettings.Anisotr: Controls the quality of the anisotropic filtering.
messages.#Settings.GaussianSplatQualitySettings.S:
When rendering Gaussian Splats, the splats must be sorted for each camera. Currently, this operation can be quite heavy, so it is spread over time to improve overall framerate.

Increase the value for sorting to happen faster. This will reduce artifacts when changing the view angle around Gaussian Splats rapidly.

Decrease the value to reduce the GPU usage if your GPU has trouble handling it. However this will increase artifacts when you rapidly change view angle.
messages.#Settings.GaussianSplatQualitySettings.Q:
This controls the quality of rendered gaussian splats and their VRAM usage. Higher quality will use more VRAM.

Very Low: ~18.62x smaller
Low: ~14x smaller
Medium: ~5.14x smaller
High: ~2.94x smaller
Very High: Uncompressed (original)
messages.#Settings.GaussianSplatQualitySettings.M:
For locally imported gaussian splats, the quality will never be lower than this value.

We do not recommend setting this below Medium, as lower quality levels are significantly more intense and time consuming to compress and should be left to compress on the cloud.

Setting this to Very High will make gaussian splats load much faster after import due to not having to be compressed at cost of high VRAM usage.
messages.#Settings.GaussianSplatQualitySettings.A: When enabled, you can configure the specific encodings used for different Gaussian Splat buffers. This gives you very fined grained control over the quality. It can also be used for testing/diagnostics purposes.
messages.#Settings.GaussianSplatQualitySettings.P: Encoding used for the positions of the splats
messages.#Settings.GaussianSplatQualitySettings.S: Encoding used for the scales of the splats
messages.#Settings.GaussianSplatQualitySettings.C: Encoding used for the colors & opacities of the splats
messages.#Settings.GaussianSplatQualitySettings.S: Encoding used for the spherical harmonic data of the splats
Toggles between fullscreen mode and windowed mode
messages.#Settings.ResolutionSettings.WindowResol: What resolution should be used when in the windowed mode. This controls the actual size of the window on the screen.
messages.#Settings.ResolutionSettings.FullscreenR: What resolution should be used when in fullscreen mode. The size will remain the same, but lowering the resolution can improve performance (particularly with high-resolution screens like 4K) at the cost of more blurry image.
messages.#Settings.RenderingQualitySettings.PerPi:
This controls how many point & spot lights can directly affect objects rendered using the forward method - typically transparent and non-PBS objects (e.g. with the toon shader).

Increasing this value will improve the quality of lighting and reduce color flickering in presence of multiple lights at the cost of performance - the object needs to be rendered multiple times for each light affecting it.
messages.#Settings.RenderingQualitySettings.Shado: This controls the resolution cascading of the shadows for directional lights in the world. Cascades better distribute the resolution of the shadow map - providing higher shadow resolution up close and lower resolution further away, but cost more performance to render.

This controls the resolution of shadows for lights. Increasing this value will give shadow smoother edges and better definition, but increase the performance requirements.

Please note that some lights might override the shadow resolution and won't be affected by this setting.

This controls the distance that shadows cover. Increasing this value will make sure more distant parts of the scene are properly covered in shadows, but this also spreads out the detail of the shadow over larger area.

You should change this setting together with the shadow cascades and resolution - with higher shadow resolution, you can afford higher shadow distance. If you lower the shadow resolution and cascades, you'll want to lower the shadow distance so shadows have better definition.
messages.#Settings.RenderingQualitySettings.SkinW:
For any skinned meshes (3D models that are deformed by bones, like most avatars), this controls how many bones are used to affect position of each vertex.

Lowering this value will save some performance, but the deformation quality will be lower, resulting in sharp creases and other artifacts, typically around joints.
messages.#Settings.ImportSettings.SessionUrls.Des:
When a Session URL is imported, what should happen. The available options are:

<color=hero.yellow>Open</color> - Open the Session.
<color=hero.yellow>SpawnInterface</color> - Spawns a representation(such as a session orb) of the URL in your current location.
<color=hero.yellow>SpawnUrl</color> - Spawns the URL in your current location as a URL Interface.
messages.#Settings.ImportSettings.WorldUrls.Descr:
When a World URL is imported, what should happen. The available options are:

<color=hero.yellow>Open</color> - Open the World.
<color=hero.yellow>SpawnInterface</color> - Spawns a representation(such as a world orb) of the world in your current location.
<color=hero.yellow>SpawnUrl</color> - Spawns the URL in your current location as a URL Interface.
messages.#Settings.ImportSettings.NetworkUrls.Des:
When a Network URL is imported, what should happen. The available options are:

<color=hero.yellow>Open</color> - Open a connection to the session at the URL.
<color=hero.yellow>SpawnInterface</color> - Spawns a representation(such as a session orb) of the url in your current location.
<color=hero.yellow>SpawnUrl</color> - Spawns the URL in your current location as a URL Interface.

messages.Inspector.CharacterController.Warning:
警告
當勾選模擬旋轉（SimulateRotation）時這個組件可以被當作一個簡單的剛體。在您這樣做之前，您需要明白它不曾為此優化，且對剛體的正式支持會在未來加入。
正式支持包括：
- CPU和網絡效能提升 - 使用角色控制器，您的CPU和網絡佔用會顯著上升
- 約束 - 您將能夠在剛體間創建關節、合頁、彈簧和其他約束
- 對每個人的平滑模擬與交互 - 在另一個人嘗試交互時，角色控制器會發生故障
- 新功能與工具 - 讓使用更加簡單
-----------------------
只要您理解了上述限制，放開玩吧！
messages.Inspector.PrimitiveMemberEditor.Warning:
警告
通過他們的ID，這個組件可以被用於與引用交互。這個過程常被稱為“引用駭入”。

在您這樣做之前，請知曉這種方式 不被 支援且隨時可能失效。請勿讓您的作品依賴於此項功能。
messages.Inspector.FacetPreset.Warning:
警告
FacetPresets 會自動在我們發布新版 Facet 物品時更新這個元件，若你正在自製 Facet，我們建議將本元件刪除。
messages.Inspector.GrabbableSaveBlock.Warning:
警告
本元件並非設計作為安全機制或竊盜保護系統使用，本元件停用直接儲存功能的用意是作為遊戲流程或是設計的一部分，要繞過這個元件的機制相當容易，本元件未來也不會加強任何安全保護措施。

messages.Tutorial.Welcome.Description:
進入一個有着無限可能性的全新數字宇宙。不管您是為了與世界各地的朋友社交，還是為了建造、創作與開發從美麗的藝術品、交互式數字化身等小玩意兒，到複雜的可交互遊戲和世界，Resonite 都為您提供了一個無限可自定義的環境。這裏永遠歡迎您，您也將能在此找到志同道合的朋友。

在您開始探索之前，我們會先引導您進行一些必要的設置，以確保絲滑的體驗。當您準備就緒，就請點擊下方的按鈕。
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.AccountDescription: 創建帳號可為您提供1GB的免費儲存空間，您將可以保存物品、喜歡的化身，添加朋友和傳遞訊息。
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.AccountSkip: 在沒有帳號的情況下繼續
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.AccountSkipDescription: 某些功能（例如，保存物品、化身，添加好友等）將無法訪問。
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SettingsDescription: 你可以配置基本動作和用戶首選項。 所有這些都可以在以後更改。
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SettingsSnapTurn.Descri: 立即轉向新的角度。適用於新用戶。
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SettingsSmoothTurn.Desc: 平滑地轉向，但易引起暈動症。
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SettingsUseHeadDirectio: 您將朝您所看的方向移動
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SettingsUseControllerDi: 您將朝您的控制器方向移動
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SidewaysTurnOnly.Descri: 僅使用此控制器進行轉向
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SidewaysTurnAndMove.Des: 使用此控制器進行轉向和移動
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.SidewaysStrafe.Descript: 使用此控制器進行側向移動
messages.Tutorial.Welcome.StartTutorialDescriptio: 您已整裝待發，即將踏上探索之旅了！我們會將您傳送到教程世界。在那之後，有一個全新的家世界等待着您。那將是您探索 {appName} 的起點。當您準備好了，請點擊下方的按鈕。
messages.Tutorial.CommunityYouTube.Title: 社群 YouTube 頻道
messages.Tutorial.Intro.BadgesDescription: 徽章是一些展示用戶特色的小圖標。這兒是一些需要被記住的重要徽章。用戶可以通過 {appName} 機器人賦予自己身體障礙徽章。請查閱 {appName} Wiki 以瞭解更多信息

messages.Migration.Title: 遷移
messages.Migration.LoginModal.Title: 遷移數據？
messages.Migration.LoginModal.Description: 您希望從另一個帳戶遷移數據嗎？您也可以選擇稍後再從儀表盤上的“遷移”標籤頁執行此操作。
messages.Migration.LoginResetID.Title: 確定要重置UserID嗎？
messages.Migration.LoginResetID.Description: 請您知悉，執行此項操作會導致 <color=red>難以預知的內容損壞</color>。您所有的物品、世界、好友和訊息都將被成功遷移，但任何依賴於您舊UserID引用的行為與組件很可能會不再工作，需要進行重新配置。<color=red>不！要！使用這個選項</color> 除非您有非常充分的理由。
messages.Migration.ReservedUsername.Title: 被保留的使用者名稱
messages.Migration.ReservedUsername.Description: 這個使用者名稱正為原擁有者所保留。如果這是您的帳戶，請提供您的 {platform} 憑據來解鎖它。我們不會保留這些憑據，它們只在註冊時被用於驗證您對帳戶的所有權。
messages.Migration.Dialog.Title: 帳戶遷移
messages.Migration.Dialog.Source: 您可以遷移來自任何兼容基礎設施的數據。首先，從下方的列表中選擇一個您希望自其遷移數據的基礎設施。您也可以通過在安裝文件夾下的“Migrations”文件夾放置配置文件來添加額外基礎設施。
messages.Migration.Dialog.AccountDescription: 要遷移您的帳戶，我們需要您的 {platform} 帳戶密碼以登錄並訪問數據。
messages.Migration.ResetID.Title: 重置我的UserID
messages.Migration.ResetID.Description: 警告： 選擇這個選項 會不可還原地部分損壞現存內容，其中包括用戶內容、社區服務、鏈接、雲變量等中任何對UserID的引用。這些引用會被重置，但您的物品、世界、好友與訊息不會丟失。我們 只 建議您在想更換一個新的隨機UserID時使用此選項。除非您有重置UserID的充分理由，您 不！該！ 使用此選項。您的UserID會像這樣變化： U-MyUsername -> U-fX3pKe7AYYQ
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Title: 當我們遷移您帳戶時，應該遷移哪些數據？
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Favorites: 收藏內容（化身、家、相機、鍵盤、Facets）
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Favorites.Descri: 這將首先遷移您的家、收藏的化身、鍵盤、相機與儀表板，這樣您就能儘快開始使用它們。 警告： 如果您選擇了這個選項，您可能 失去某些 在遷移前作出的對您收藏內容的更改。
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Favorites.Overwr: 我們應該在遷移時覆寫您的收藏夾嗎？
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Home.Title: 將您原來的家設為默認？
messages.Migration.DataSelection.Home.Description: 當我們遷移您數據時，您原本的雲端家園會被安置在一個不同的URL下，您的默認家會被設為一個全新的雲端家園。不過，如果您希望如此，我們也可以將您原有的家設置為默認。即使您選擇了“不”，您原有的家依然可以被訪問。您也可以稍後再收藏它並設為您的家。
messages.Migration.Groups.Title: 遷移羣組
messages.Migration.Groups.Introduction: 我們應該遷移您的羣組嗎？
messages.Migration.Groups.Description: 所有您作為管理員的羣組都將被默認遷移。如果您只想遷移指定羣組，點擊下方的按鈕來加載它們並選擇您希望遷移的羣組。
messages.Migration.Groups.NoGroups: 未找到可遷移的 {platform} 羣組。
messages.Migration.Groups.NotGroupAdmin: 您未擔任任何 {platform} 羣組的管理員，請聯繫您羣組的管理員以遷移它們！
messages.Migration.Summary:
好的，我們已經完成了準備工作。點擊下方的開始遷移按鈕，我們就會開始您的遷移工作。

遷移工作需要一些時間，我們需要拷貝所有的數據。如果您選擇了遷移您的收藏夾，我們會優先遷移它們以便您能夠儘快使用。

在遷移運行時，您無需保持 {appName} 運行，但我們也會通過 {appName} 機器人向您發送通知以告知您進展如何。
messages.Migration.List.EmptyTitle: 需要開始新的遷移工作嗎？
messages.Migration.List.EmptySubtitle: 點擊左上方的“新建遷移任務”按鈕
messages.Migration.Report.Title: 遷移任務報告：
messages.Migration.Report.CurrentRate: <color={hex}>當前速度：</color> ~{value} 世界/項目每分鐘
messages.Migration.Report.ContactStatus: 已遷移 <color={hex}>{total}</color> 好友中的 <color={hex}>{current}</color> 個
messages.Migration.Report.CloudVariableDefinition: 已遷移 <color={hex}>{value}</color> 個雲變量定義
messages.Migration.Report.RecordStatus: 已遷移 <color={hex}>{total}</color> 世界/項目中的 <color={hex}>{current}</color> 個，失敗 <color=red>{failed}</color> 個。
messages.Migration.Report.GroupStatus: 已遷移 <color={hex}>{total}</color> 羣組中的 <color={hex}>{current}</color> 個
messages.Migration.Report.GroupMemberStatus: 共已遷移 <color={hex}>{value}</color> 羣組成員
messages.Migration.NothingSelected: 未選擇任何項，無法開始。
messages.Migration.ColorManagement:
這個世界在伽馬色彩空間下被創建，目前已被自動轉換至線性色彩空間。

它看起來可能會有些不同，但總體應當保持可用。

如果您就是作者且發現了世界轉換中的錯誤，不！要！存！儲！ 僅進行另存。

只要原始世界存在，我們還可以改良轉換流程。否則您將自己負責修復這些錯誤。
messages.Temporary.MMC.Categories.Name: 類別
messages.Temporary.MMC.VoteFailure: 投票失敗，您的投票未被成功計票，請重試。
messages.Temporary.MMC.VotedAlready: 您已經為 {voteTarget} 投過票了。
messages.Tutorial.Saving.Title: 歡迎回家！
messages.Tutorial.Saving.Content:
歡迎來到您的 家 世界！這是您每次登錄後所來到的地方。

這是一個您自己的世界，您可以保存任何所作的更改。

如果您保存了，當您下次回來時，一切將與您離開時一模一樣！
messages.Tutorial.Teleporter.Error:
無法載入您的雲端家世界！
走出傳送器然後再走回來試試看。
messages.CloudHome.Info.OnlineUsers:
在線 {online_users,plural, one {用戶} other {用戶}}: {online_users}
可加入 {joinable_users,plural, one {用戶} other {用戶}}: {joinable_users}
messages.CloudHome.Info.DashInfoTab.Title: 歡迎！
messages.CloudHome.Info.DashInfoDesktop:
為了讓您更快上手，有幾件事您應當知悉。當按下Esc鍵，您可以打開 儀表盤。它相當於您的桌面或是控制面板。

如果您對此感到疑惑，它用於顯示能夠幫助您的額外數據。點擊下方按鈕關閉這條消息。
messages.CloudHome.Info.DashInfoVR:
為了讓您更快上手，有幾件事您應當知悉。當按下B或Y鍵，您可以打開 儀表盤。它相當於您的桌面或是控制面板。

如果您對此感到疑惑，它用於顯示能夠幫助您的額外數據。點擊下方按鈕關閉這條消息。
messages.CloudHome.Info.DashInfoVRNoButtons:
為了讓您更快上手，有幾件事您應當知悉。當您按住菜單鍵直到圓圈填滿，您可以打開 儀表盤。它相當於您的桌面或是控制面板。

如果您對此感到疑惑，它用於顯示能夠幫助您的額外數據。點擊下方按鈕關閉這條消息。
messages.CloudHome.Info.ModerationTab.Title: 監管！
messages.CloudHome.Info.ModerationTab.Content:
安全很重要！如果您需要幫助或者需要舉報一位用戶，請在我們的 監管平臺發起工單。

我們有由志願管理員組成的強大團隊 來保障社區的安全！如果您有疑問，或是發現了違反行為準則的現象，請發起工單。
messages.CloudHome.Info.InventoryTab.Title: 儲存您的物品！
messages.CloudHome.Info.InventoryTab.Content:
在 儀表盤 中的 庫存 包含了您保存的物品與化身。

在 基礎 文件夾中，我們準備了一些有趣的東西。您可以雙擊來生成它們！
messages.CloudHome.Info.ToolsTab.Title: 世界內編輯！
messages.CloudHome.Info.ToolsTab.Content:
{appName} 的一大特點在於，您能夠輕易的在遊戲中創造、修改事物。

是的！就在此處！實際上在任何地方都可以。您可以在庫存中的 基礎 -> 工具 欄找到用於修改世界的工具，並將一切變成您喜歡的樣子。
messages.CloudHome.Info.HelpTab.Title: 獲得幫助
messages.CloudHome.Info.HelpTab.InfoLineOne: 需要幫助？查看我們的 <u><color=hero.cyan>Wiki</color></u><sprite name=hyperlink>，或者詢問以獲得解答。
messages.CloudHome.Info.HelpTab.InfoLineTwo: 在我們的 Discord! 中提問，通過您儀表盤中的 桌面 標籤頁，您可以輕易地在桌面模式下查看鏈接。
messages.CloudHome.Info.UsersTab.Title: 查找用戶
messages.CloudHome.Info.UsersTab.Content:
公共會話會是讓您沉浸在社區氛圍中的一個好去處！

您可以在儀表板中的 世界 標籤頁找到可以立即加入的公共會話。快去看看吧！
messages.StickyNote.RelevantLinks:
相關鏈接！
<--

甚至可以叫它黃頁
messages.StickyNote.SunTool: 以您之手掌握太陽之力！
messages.StickyNote.Crossbow: 使用槓桿（或是次級）來裝填！
messages.StickyNote.TheaterTablet: 使用這個平板來控制房間的風扇與窗戶！
messages.StickyNote.ControlTablet: 使用這個平板來控制家的各個部分！
messages.StickyNote.DipBrushes: 將筆刷浸入材質球來選擇材質
messages.StickyNote.BrushColor: 在您的上下文菜單中更改筆刷的顏色與大小
messages.StickyNote.Drawing: 您可以在畫板上或空氣中繪畫。事實上，在哪都行！
messages.CloudHome.FeaturedPanel.LinkText:
點擊這裏
來為您打開世界！
messages.CloudHome.AvatarPanel.Title: 精選化身世界
messages.CloudHome.SupporterPanel.Title: 我們的支持者們
messages.Tutorial.InfoPanel.Title: 嘿！在您繼續之前...
messages.Tutorial.InfoPanel.Content:
等待着您的是一個充滿可能性的世界，您的想象將是唯一的限制。

您迄今所見之物幾乎都是在遊戲內開發的！來自世界各地的人們實時協作、共同建造了它們。

這個平臺仍處於早期開發階段，我們在不斷更新和改進它。現在，您也是這旅程的一份子了！海闊憑魚躍，天高任鳥飛！

感謝您駐足體驗。
messages.Tutorial.Panel.Jumping.Title: 跳躍
messages.Tutorial.Panel.Jumping.ContentDesktop: 在行走時，按下空格鍵跳躍！
messages.Tutorial.Panel.Jumping.ContentVR: 在行走時，按下搖桿跳躍！
messages.Tutorial.Panel.Jumping.ContentVRNoButton: 在行走時，按下觸控板中心跳躍！
messages.Tutorial.Panel.WalkLocomotion.Title: 行走移動
messages.Tutorial.Panel.TeleportLocomotion.Title: 傳送移動
messages.Tutorial.Panel.TeleportLocomotion.Conten: 立即將您傳送至傳送指示器位置
messages.Hints.Spawn.InitialMovementDesktop: 使用運動鍵位來四處移動！
messages.Hints.Spawn.InitialMovementVRNoButtons: 使用觸控板來四處行走！
messages.Hints.Spawn.ContextMenuDesktop: 按T打開您的上下文菜單以查看選項！
messages.Hints.Spawn.ContextMenuVR: 感到不適？按B或Y鍵打開您的上下文菜單以查看選項！
messages.Hints.Spawn.ContextMenuVRNoButtons: 感到不適？按菜單鍵打開您的上下文菜單以查看選項！
messages.Hints.Spawn.TeleportLocomotionDesktop: 您可以在運動菜單中嘗試其他選項，例如飛行。
messages.Hints.Spawn.TeleportLocomotionVR: 您可以在運動菜單中嘗試其他選項，例如傳送或飛行。
messages.Hints.Bridge.RaiseTheWorld: 按下這個按鈕，召喚平臺！
messages.Hints.Grabbing.GrabbingDesktop: 按住鼠標右鍵以符合物理地抓取物品！
messages.Hints.Grabbing.GrabbingVR: 按下抓握鍵以符合物理地抓取物品！
messages.Hints.Grabbing.Rotating: 按住E鍵並移動鼠標以旋轉抓取的物品！
messages.Hints.Grabbing.RotatingExtra: 同時按住Shift鍵與E鍵來繞其水平軸旋轉物品！
messages.Hints.Grabbing.ScalingDesktop: 抓取一個物品，按住Shift鍵，使用您的滾輪來縮放它！
messages.Hints.Grabbing.ScalingVR: 用您的雙手抓取物品來縮放它們！
messages.Hints.Grabbing.OtherGrabbables: 我們提供了繁多的交互類型，擺弄這三件物品來瞭解它們！
messages.Hints.Grabbing.OtherGrabbablesExtraDeskt: 除了縮放物體，您也可以在上下文菜單中啟用縮放來縮放自己。按住Ctrl並使用滾輪即可！
messages.Hints.Grabbing.OtherGrabbablesExtraVR: 除了縮放物體，您也可以在上下文菜單中啟用縮放來縮放自己。用雙手抓取它，然後將其移動得更近或更遠！
messages.Hints.Telescope.Alignment: 抓取望遠鏡並將其對準月亮！
messages.Hints.Telescope.TheMoonDesktop: 在對準月亮時，按住右鍵並移動視角來移動月亮！
messages.Hints.Telescope.TheMoonVR: 按下扳機鍵以激活激光並抓取、移動月亮！
messages.Hints.Sundial.SoftEquip: 抓取這個工具並使用它！
messages.Hints.Sundial.SoftEquipExtra: 工具使您能夠以多種方式改變您所處的世界！
messages.Hints.Sundial.HardEquip: 點擊這個工具來裝備它！
messages.Hints.Sundial.HardEquipExtra: 沒有看見激光指示器？輕按您的扳機鍵來顯示它！
messages.Hints.Sundial.TheSun: 瞄準天空並點擊來移動太陽！
messages.Hints.Sundial.TheSunExtra: 試試瞄準地平線以下，將時間變成晚上！
messages.Hints.Sundial.Dequip: 通過在上下文菜單中選擇取消裝備來丟棄已裝備的工具。
messages.Hints.Sundial.DequipExtra: 注意，上下文菜單中的選項因您正手持工具而發生了改變。
messages.Hints.Sundial.Teleporter: 按下這個按鈕來激活通向您雲端家園的傳送器！
messages.Hints.Sundial.TeleporterExtra: 請享受您的家，感謝您駐足體驗！
messages.Universe.Technology.Ingenuity: NASA 火星創新號直升機
messages.Universe.Landmarks.DistanceFromLA2SF: 洛杉磯到舊金山的距離
